regularizer Class Reference

A program to regularize PDB structures. More...

List of all members.

Detailed Description

The goals of the program regularize are explained in detail in Regularization: approximating a protein structure. Usage: 

  regularize [OPTIONS] somefile.pdb

where options could be :

  • --geometric_only or -g : Stop after RMSD minimization
  • --good_enough_rmsd or -gr : Stop conjugate gradient minimization cycles for the RMSD minimization part once RMSD falls below a given value.
  • --num_e_minim_cycles or -nec : Number of cycles of minimization of E+k*RMSD . A cycle with k=0 is always done at the end.
  • --initial_RMSD_factor or -f0 : Initial factor k in e+k*RMSD
  • --final_RMSD_factor or -f1 : Final factor k in e+k*RMSD
  • --log_level or -ll : Verbosity of log messages
  • --mccyc_per_minim or -nmc : Number of MC cycles before each conjugate gradient minimization cycle

Examples

The simplest use case is 

  regularize abc.pdb

This produces two files min_etot.xml and min_rmsd.xml.

  regularize -g -gr 0.5

The above will produce only a file min_rmsd.xml and stop either when the RMSD minimization process converges or when the RMSD value reaches 0.5 Å.

See also:
Regularization: approximating a protein structure
